title: Showers expected in parts of the island
byline: The Meteorology Department says a few showers may occur in Uva Province and in Batticaloa, Ampara and Hambantota districts.

title: New govt to present inaugural Budget today
byline: The 2025 Budget is scheduled to be presented to Parliament today (17), marking the first budget to be presented by President Anura Kumara Dissanayake since assuming office.

title: Irrigation Asst. Engineers launch trade union action
byline: The Assistant Engineers of the Department of Irrigation have decided to launch trade union action by reporting sick leave today (17) and tomorrow (18).

title: Magnitude 4.0 earthquake hits India’s New Delhi
byline: New Delhi and several parts of northern India were shaken by strong earthquake tremors early Monday morning. The strong tremors caused residents of high-rise buildings in Delhi, Noida, Greater Noida, and Ghaziabad to rush out of their homes.

title: Sri Lanka Budget seeks to balance poll pledges with IMF demands – Report
byline: Sri Lanka President Anura Kumara Dissanayake will need to walk a tightrope in his budget Monday, seeking to reduce the economic burden on the poor while taking steps to keep a $3 billion International Monetary Fund bailout on track.

title: Govt. pledges measures to prevent train delays
byline: The government has announced plans to increase the number of locomotive engines in operation daily to minimize train delays and cancellations.

title: South Korean actress Kim Sae-ron found dead at home
byline: South Korean actress Kim Sae-ron has been found dead at her home, a police official with knowledge of the case said on Sunday.

title: Cabinet approval to present Budget 2025 to Parliament
byline: The Cabinet of Ministers has granted approval for the Budget 2025 to be presented to the Parliament, Cabinet Spokesman Minister Dr. Nalinda Jayatissa said.

title: Sri Lanka Army clarifies passport retention policy for personnel
byline: The Sri Lanka Army has issued a statement clarifying the retention of passports belonging to Army personnel following various interpretations circulating regarding an administrative order issued by Army Headquarters on February 16.

title: 12 injured in bus-van collision in Wewetenna
byline: At least 12 individuals have been injured in an accident that occurred at around 6.10 a.m. this morning (17) in the Wewetenna area on the Kandaketiya-Bopitiya road when a private bus and a van collided on a winding section of the narrow roadway.

title: President arrives in Parliament to present 2025 Budget
byline: President Anura Kumara Dissanayake arrived in Parliament, a short while ago, to present the 2025 Budget.

title: President Dissanayake begins inaugural Budget Speech
byline: President Anura Kumara Dissanayake, who arrived in Parliament a short while ago, commenced the 2025 Budget Speech in the House.

title: LIVE UPDATES: 2025 Budget Speech
byline: President Anura Kumara Dissanayake commenced delivering the 2025 Budget Speech in the parliament, a short while ago.

title: Sri Lanka’s GDP growth for 2025 expected at 5% - President
byline: President Anura Kumara Dissanayake says that Sri Lanka’s economy is expected to grow approximately by 5% in 2025.

title: Sri Lanka to introduce National Tariff Policy, new Customs Act
byline: President Anura Kumara Dissanayake says that a National Tariff Policy and a new Customs Act will be introduced aimed at the development of Sri Lanka’s Export Industry.

title: Sri Lanka to gradually exit use of currency notes: President on digital economic development plans
byline: President Anura Kumara Dissanayake says that a Digital Economic Authority will be established, and a new legal framework for digital payments will be introduced in order to fasten the digital economy further.

title: President announces budget allocations to boost tourism sector
byline: Delivering his maiden Budget Speech in parliament today (17), President Anura Kumara Dissanayake announced that the country expects to welcome over 2.5 million tourists in 2025.

title: No vehicle permits or new vehicles for MPs this year: President
byline: President Anura Kumara Dissanayake outlined a series of cost-cutting measures aimed at managing public expenditure as part of the 2025 budget proposals.

title: Historic budget allocation for health sector in 2025, says President
byline: President Anura Kumara Dissanayake, while delivering 2025 budget speech, said that the government’s budget allocation for the health sector for 2025 has been significantly increased to Rs. 604 billion.

title: New luxury bus service to operate under ‘Metro’ bus company
byline: President Anura Kumara Dissanayake says that public transport systems – buses, highways and train services – will be developed and renovated both in urban and rural areas of the country, considering it a ‘very timely situation’.

title: Kelani Valley railway line to be extended
byline: Speaking regarding the budget proposals for the development of the railway services, President Anura Kumara Dissanayake said that the government will focus on manufacturing and renovation of railway compartments within the country itself.

title: Rs. 3,000 million allocated to accelerate Sri Lanka’s digital economy
byline: In a move to boost Sri Lanka’s digital economy, the government has proposed an allocation of Rs. 3,000 million, President Anura Kumara Dissanayake announced today.

title: Public sector salary increase: Minimum basic salary raised by Rs. 15,750
byline: The government has proposed a revision to the public sector salary structure as part of the 2025 Budget, improving the minimum wages and streamlining the allowances.

title: Budget deficit for 2025 estimated at Rs. 2,200 billion
byline: President Anura Kumara Dissanayake, in his capacity as the Minister of Finance, Economic Stabilization and National Policies, presented his maiden full budget aimed at developing the country in a way that enables it to repay debt when repayment commences in 2028 today (17).

title: 2025 Budget: Significant allocations made to revamp education sector
byline: The Sri Lankan government has announced a series of significant investments in the education sector under the 2025 Budget, focusing on infrastructure development, scholarships, modernization, and improved accessibility for students at all levels.

title: Public sector pensions to be revised under 3 phases
byline: Delivering the 2025 Budget speech in Parliament today (17), President Anura Kumara Dissanayake proposed to revise the pensions of all pensioners who retired before 01 January 2020 in three phases, corresponding to the salary scales applicable to the year 2020 as per the Public Administration Circular No. 03/2016.

title: President Dissanayake’s full budget speech
byline: President Anura Kumara Dissanayake, in his capacity as the Minister of Finance, Economic Stabilization and National Policies, presented his maiden Budget Speech in the Parliament today (17).

title: Price of bread flour reduced
byline: Serendib Flour Mills, together with Prima, the leading flour manufacturers in Sri Lanka, have collaborated with the Ministry of Trade to support the government’s cost of living reduction initiatives.

title: Court of Appeal Acting President’s term extended
byline: The term of Acting President of the Court of Appeal Justice Mohammed Thahir Laffar has been extended, the President’s Media Division (PMD) said.

title: “No difference between previous budget and this budget” - Harsha
byline: SJB Member of Parliament Dr. Harsha de Silva has questioned the ideological shift of the Janatha Vimukthi Peramuna (JVP) and the National People”s Power (NPP), claiming that the parties are now proposing the same neoliberal economic reforms they previously opposed.

title: Heat index to hit ‘caution level’ in parts of the island
byline: The Meteorology Department has issued a Heat Index Advisory for Northern, North-central, North-western, Western and Southern provinces and Rathnapura district, effective for tomorrow (Feb 18).

title: South Korea removes Deepseek from app stores over privacy concerns
byline: South Korea has banned new downloads of China’s DeepSeek artificial intelligence (AI) chatbot, according to the country’s personal data protection watchdog.

title: Second Reading of LG Elections Bill passed in Parliament
byline: The Second Reading of the Local Authorities Elections (Special Provisions) Bill has been passed in Parliament with a special majority.

title: LG Elections Bill passed by a special majority in Parliament
byline: The Local Authorities Elections (Special Provisions) Bill was passed by a special majority, without amendments in Parliament today (17).

title: Speaker endorses certificate on LG Elections (Special Provisions) Bill
byline: The Speaker of Parliament Dr. Jagath Wickramaratne has endorsed the certificate on the Local Authorities Elections (Special Provisions) Bill today (Feb 17) in Parliament, in accordance with Article 79 of the Constitution.

title: Deputy Minister hits out at ‘fake news’ on Ella Rock firefighting efforts
byline: Deputy Minister of Tourism Ruwan Ranasinghe has issued a statement regarding the firefighting operations in the area around Ella Rock, expressing concern over false information being spread on the matter.

title: European leaders gather for an emergency meeting over fear Trump has isolated age-old allies
byline: French President Emmanuel Macron had a phone call with Donald Trump just as he was about to greet key European Union nations and the United Kingdom at the Elysee Palace on Monday for an emergency meeting on how to react to the U.S. diplomatic blitz on Ukraine, which left the once rock-solid partner as a potential political liability.

title: Missing Police Constable’s T-56 firearm recovered
byline: The T-56 assault rifle of the Police Constable (PC) attached to the Mount Lavinia Police Station, who went missing and is suspected to have fled overseas, has been recovered along with the ammunition.
